Creator: Jon Burton
Description: A true director's cut made by the original game's director. Adds improved controls, bug fixes, save support, a new map screen, new modes, Super Sonic, and much more, all while keeping the original game intact via a menu option.

Original Game: Super Mario Advance 4: Super Mario Bros. 3
Creator: Nintendo
Description: An official rerelease that includes all 38 e-Reader levels unlocked from the start. This includes levels that were previously Japan-only and removes the original game's 32 e-Reader level limitation. Available through the Wii U Virtual Console and Nintendo Switch Online.

Creator: Tomato
Description: Makes the game less grind-heavy by doubling earned EXP and money. Originally made for the unofficial EarthBound Zero release, but also works with the official ROM released later.

Creator: Summer Dragonfly
Description: Increases the audio quality and reduces the 'background hiss' that some GBA soundtracks are known for.

Creator: Nikokaro
Description: Replaces the original game's gyro controls with normal button inputs. A small number of microgames are made much more challenging, if not impossible, by this change.

Creator: Nikokaro
Description: Replaces the original game's gyro controls with normal button inputs.

Creator: Nikokaro
Description: Replaces the original game's gyro controls with normal button inputs.

Creator: infinest
Description: Replaces the original game's gyro controls with normal button inputs.

Creator: MojoDodo
Description: Adds color, a level select, high score saving, a bug fix, and other assorted polish.

Creator: marc_max
Description: Adds color, Luigi+Daisy+Wario as playable characters with their own color palettes, and other minor changes.

Creator: korxo
Description: Adds color.

Creator: marc_max
Description: Adds color, removes slowdown, and adds an NES-style pause screen plus other minor changes.

Creator: kkzero
Description: Adds color and other visual flair, which can be changed in a new settings menu. Also removes slowdown and adds a toggle for animal friends' BGM.

Creator: Yoshifanatic
Description: Adds full save functionality with three save files. Also adds a sound test to the main menu.

Hack: Castlevania Adventure Autoboot + Speed + Whip Hack
Creator: richirobot
Description: Autoboots into Castlevania: The Adventure, increases player speed, and makes it so that your whip doesn't get downgraded when you take damage. Separate patches are included for speed, whip, or both.

Creator: ProstatePunch
Description: Re-colors Castlevania: The Adventure. Includes the Autoboot + Speed + Whip hack pre-patched and removes the ability to exit to the game selection screen, effectively making the game Castlevania-only.

Hack: Mega Man World: Dr. Wily's Revenge GBC
Creator: Specialagentape
Description: Adds color (including weapon icons and colors) and reduces slowdown.

Creator: Q
Description: Several names have been changed with the intent of either matching the original Japanese script more closely, or removing ambiguity/confusion. Also fixes some grammar.

Creator: Specialagentape
Description: Adds color, a new rain effect, a sound test, and two optional new gameplay modes: Follower Kong (the Kong you are not playing as will follow you, like in the SNES version) and New Kiddy Mode (easy mode).

Creator: toruzz
Description: Adds color, multiple player sprites, Luigi as a second character with different physics, a new options menu, battery saves, and a bunch of other changes/fixes along with removing slowdown.

Creator: toruzz
Description: Adds color, adds Luigi as a second character with different physics, and removes slowdown. The Bunny Mario Graphics Fix (Stifu) addendum fixes a minor bug that was also present in the original game.

Creator: GreenAndACat
Description: Adds color. Has two addendums: Revised (ShadowOne333) which adds several fixes, and Fluffy Repair Service (minucce) which adds more fixes on top of Revised.

Creator: Prof. 9
Description: Merges many features from the three versions of Star Force together into one game, makes Japan-only content accessible through new means, removes the need for touch controls, adds new side content, updates the font to match later games, and more.

Original Game: Mega Man Star Force 2: Zerker x Saurian
Hack: Mega Man Star Force 2 Not Quite DX
Creator: Prof. 9
Description: Significantly reduces random encounter rates (except when using search sub-cards), simplifies some progression-related requirements, and makes download-related events accessible through normal means.

Creator: Ospin
Description: Reworks/adds several gameplay mechanics to be more in line with modern entries, including Super Rotation System (SRS), bagging, hard drop, hold pieces, ghost pieces, T-spins, and more. An addendum, Rosy Retrospection DX (Creepercraft), adds color and fixes some bugs from the original hack.

Creator: MojoDodo
Description: Adds color.

Creator: kkzero
Description: Adds color and removes slowdown.

Creator: kkzero
Description: Adds color and higher framerates, and fixes an audio bug. Includes two patches; the GDMA version has better performance, but may be buggy depending on the emulator/hardware (BGB or VBA is recommended) and can break multiplayer.

Creator: Specialagentape
Description: Adds color, a time attack mode, unused music, and several quality of life improvements. Press Select on the overworld for a new menu.

Creator: EJRTQ
Description: Adds color.

Hack: Pokemon Red / Blue Full Color Hack
Creator: Drenn
Description: Adds color, resulting in visuals that are very similar to GSC. The download includes both Red and Blue, and there are two patches for each: one replaces the trainer/Pokemon battle sprites and HUD with their more detailed GSC counterparts, while the other simply colorizes the original sprites.

Original Game: The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening DX
Creator: Tzepish
Description: Replaces the text font with the more readable font from the Oracle games.

Creator: Issun
Description: Fixes many bugs, broken routines, and mishandled graphics.

Creator: Mips96
Description: Changes story mode text to reflect Kirby's depiction in later games, and fixes grammatical errors. Download includes an alternate patch that also replaces all references to 'Avalanche' with 'Puyo Puyo'.

Creator: Skelux Core
Description: Adds button controls to all rhythm games. Menus and pre-game dialogue still require touch controls.

Creator: Creepercraft
Description: Adds color, a secret mode, and some easter eggs. The download includes two patches, each with different color variations based on SRS and TGM respectively.

Creator: Capcom
Description: The Virtual Console releases of the MMBN games include several changes, many of which involve making multiplayer or e-Reader-exclusive content accessible through normal means, though there are also minor graphical changes. However, multiplayer does not work. More info

Creator: marc_max
Description: Adds color.

Creator: ShaneM
Description: Fixes 'pretty much' every known glitch.

Creator: i_hate_drm
Description: Adds many assorted quality of life improvements including better menus, softlock-preventing map edits, and more.

Creator: samspot
Description: Removes the warning music that plays at low health.

Creator: motke
Description: Fixes the AI freezing under certain common circumstances.

Creator: Diogo Ribeiro
Description: Restores content that went unused in the US release; most notably, the first level of Planet Terra and its intro + music.

Creator: Shibunoa
Description: Converts the game to a Master System game, with a larger screen size due to the higher resolution. However, since the controls have not been reworked to account for the Master System's lack of a Start button, pausing and exiting the demo video prematurely are no longer possible.

Creator: Glitch
Description: Converts the game to a Master System game, with a larger screen size due to the higher resolution, and controls being altered accordingly. However, the audio output is now mono.

Creator: YasaSheep
Description: Allows the player to catch Mew and Celebi without having participated in the live Japan-only event.

Creator: Bock
Description: Enables support for the Japan-only FM Unit in European/US mode.

Creator: SSTranslations
Description: Enables support for the Japan-only FM Unit in European/US mode. Also changes some names and uses of capitalization to match later games.

Creator: Ambil
Description: Adds rings to boss acts, improves the HUD, and adds Arrow monitors from Sonic 1 GG.

Creator: Johnny
Description: Fixes several mistranslated names and typos.

Creator: Ravenfreak
Description: Adds the Strike Dash ability from Sonic Chaos and Triple Trouble.

Creator: Ichigobankai
Description: Adds SRAM save/load functionality and, if using a Genesis controller, the ability to pause with Start.

Creator: Ichigobankai
Description: Adds SRAM save/load functionality. Also incorporates a bugfix patch (Erik R. Quinn). Also reduces the number of onscreen enemies to make the game easier, but another patch (LemFliggity) reverts this change.

Creator: Ichigobankai
Description: Adds SRAM save/load functionality.

Creator: Ichigobankai
Description: Adds SRAM save/load functionality, the ability to pause if using a Genesis controller, and altered color palettes.

Creator: MiRIr
Description: Makes Level 10 accessible via level select like all other levels.

Creator: EvilJagaGenius
Description: Increases the amount of XP, money, or both obtained from enemies.

Creator: Emulacion sin secretos
Description: Improves the password system so that all sublevels can now be accessed via password. Also heavily simplifies passwords, effectively making the password input a level select.

Creator: Yim
Description: Adds several changes to make the game less grind-heavy: full restore on continue/inn stay, no loss of horns on continue, and earth magic is free to use if it doesn't hit an enemy.

Creator: xfixium
Description: Changes several graphics to more accurately match the arcade release. Also includes a Champion Edition variant.

Creator: Valleybell
Description: Adds optional FM music, audio-related optimizations and bug fixes, and additional songs as easter eggs.

Creator: JCE3000GT
Description: Several balance changes have been applied to make the game significantly easier.

Creator: FRS
Description: Fixes a crash bug and allows enables on CHGCPU-compatible machines.

Creator: FRS
Description: Fixes speed/framerate bugs, adjusts control schemes to be more consistent, and enables turbo on CHGCPU-compatible machines.

Creator: FRS
Description: Improves performance and enables turbo on CHGCPU-compatible machines.

Creator: FRS
Description: Enables turbo on CHGCPU-compatible machines.

Creator: FRS
Description: Improves performance and enables turbo on CHGCPU-compatible machines.

Creator: FRS
Description: Improves performance, removes region lock, adjusts some graphics, and enables turbo on CHGCPU-compatible machines.

Creator: FRS
Description: Enables turbo on CHGCPU-compatible machines.

Creator: FRS
Description: Improves performance and enables turbo on CHGCPU-compatible machines.

Creator: FRS
Description: Improves performance and fixes the ripple-laser to behave like the arcade version.

Creator: hmsong
Description: Changes postgame commander checks to not require multiplayer. Also compatible with the English translation.

Creator: bidoof3836
Description: Applies a wide variety of balance changes.

Original Game: Final Fantasy I & II: Dawn of Souls
Creator: Maeson
Description: Applies a wide variety of balance changes to FF1, along with some minor changes to FF2, and incorporates <a href='https://www.romhacking.net/hacks/3459/' target='_blank'>Kea's Vancian Magic System</href>, which re-adds the magic system from the NES version. Includes optional patches for further tweaking.

Creator: hmsong
Description: Allows the Rising Chimera fight to be allowed through a password instead of Gamecube connectivity. Also compatible with the English translation.

Creator: Pemburu Vampir
Description: Changes several color palettes and sprites.

Creator: godcloakburmy
Description: Applies many balance changes, intended to promote more strategic play and make the early game more challenging while allowing for more creative playstyles.

Creator: SCD
Description: Changes and fixes many things to make the game more similar to the arcade version.

Creator: RealGaea
Description: Changes and fixes many things to make the game more similar to the arcade version.

Hack: A More Modern Nightmare In Dream Land
Creator: mattdog1000000
Description: Similar to later entries, you no longer drop your ability every time you take damage, and Up no longer jumps.

Creator: mattdog1000000
Description: Similar to later entries, you no longer drop your ability every time you take damage, and Up no longer jumps.

Original Game: Mega Man Battle Network 3: Blue / White

Creator: hmsong
Description: Fixes a large number of minor bugs. Also compatible with the English translation.

Creator: Cornholio309
Description: Rearranges a few boss themes to match the bosses they were originally made for.

Creator: Anthony Ryuki
Description: Fixes Port Town's bass line being too low-pitched.

Creator: Mateo
Description: Fixes some inconsistent names in the music player.

Creator: FF6Hacking Community
Description: Fixes the flash animation being misaligned.

Creator: silverd
Description: Fixes certain animations not being played when they should.

Original Game: Super Mario Advance 4: Super Mario Bros. 3
Creator: Mario_GMD
Description: Fixes some minor sprite/animation issues.

Original Game: Final Fantasy I & II: Dawn of Souls
Creator: Rabite
Description: Fixes incorrect critical hit rates, which were carried over from the NES version.

Original Game: Final Fantasy I & II: Dawn of Souls
Creator: Rabite
Description: Makes the Angel Ring, which was originally inaccessible due to a bug, a 10% drop by Holy Dragons.

Creator: Rabite
Description: A collection of patches that buff Bullet souls, MP regeneration, and Luck.

Creator: Schicksal88
Description: Fixes Siegfried's and Typon's rages being inaccessible.

Original Game: Mega Man Battle Network 4: Blue Moon / Red Sun
Creator: Exeguy11
Description: Fixes several bugs, including Navi chip freezes and the WoodMan scenario glitch.

Original Game: Super Street Fighter II Turbo Revival
Creator: Exeguy11
Description: Fixes several bugs, including the Akuma glitch and a few win quotes.

Original Game: The Legend of Zelda: The Minish Cap
Creator: Prof. 9
Description: Backports several changes from the Japanese and North American releases to the European version, including the third bomb bag upgrade and a bug fix.

Creator: Lenophis, Imzogelmo, Novalia Spirit
Description: Fixes a bug involving enemy spawn rates/types.

Creator: Deathlike2
Description: Fixes the Defender Sword incorrectly targeting enemies with Protect. Also includes a patch which changes certain weapon behavior to match the original FF4.

Creator: Deathlike2
Description: Fixes Yang's HP not increasing past level 60.

Creator: Radagast
Description: Fixes several mistranslations and text errors.

Creator: Mister Man
Description: Replaces Yoshi's voice clips, originally from Yoshi's Story, with those from Mario Kart 64.

Original Game: Mega Man Battle Network 4: Blue Moon / Red Sun
Creator: vgperson
Description: Changes text to be more faithful to the Japanese version and less error-prone while keeping true to the official English script.

Creator: JackitK
Description: Implements several quality-of-life changes from the rom hack 'Dawn of Djinn', including Retreat working as fast travel, Avoid disabling random encounters, and some Psynergy being made more accessible.

Creator: Gigan
Description: Applies several changes to make the game easier, aiming for 'non-stress/exhilaration'.

Creator: Gigan
Description: Applies several changes to make the game easier, aiming for 'non-stress/exhilaration'.

Creator: Gigan
Description: Applies several changes to make the game easier.

Description: Applies several changes to make the game easier, and changes the name of the main character.

Creator: Piggy Chan!
Description: Gives the game a darker color palette to accommodate backlit screens.

Creator: Piggy Chan!
Description: Gives the game a darker color palette to accommodate backlit screens.

Creator: Gigan
Description: Applies several changes to make the game easier.

Creator: djedditt
Description: Adds rumble support for both the GBA rumble pack and Game Boy Player.

Creator: Saetta06
Description: Inspired by the Lap mechanic from Pizza Tower. When escaping a level, there's a warp by the entrance which sends you back to the frog switch with limited time, but rewards you with diamonds.

Creator: Tsuki Zero
Description: Removes the common film projector flicker, which was an epilepsy concern.

Creator: hmsong
Description: Overhauls item accessibility via shops and prizes, along with some other related changes.

Creator: Tracker_TD
Description: Adjusts enemy and pit locations, adds new level routes, adds more special rings, and reduces the requirement for Special Stage entry.
